III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) The facility is in compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) The facility is in compliance with all additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was provided consultation regarding the updated requirements and
approved variance for annual staff TB testing.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
Chief Administrator noted there have been no identified areas of non-compliance. The
last licensing review resulted in no findings. There were no unplanned discharges in
2022. All residents who discharged from the program did so successfully.
Staff and Youth Interviews:
Interviews with all youth and employees were very positive. All youth interviewed feel
safe at the facility and feel staff keep their peers safe as well. Youth feel staff really
care about them and feel very supported by staff. Youth stated they have enough
food, and the food staff cook is great! Youth really enjoy the outings they go on as
part of the program and like they can have fun with staff and peers. Employees feel
the program is great and they really enjoy working at Maple Lodge. Employees were
unanimous in feeling they were a part of the team and had a voice in contributing to
changes within the program. All employees reported feeling supported by supervisors
and upper management. One employee noted there is never a problem with staffing
because staff retention has been excellent, it’s a great environment and most staff
want to work more than their required shifts. The same employee noted youth and
staff are always learning from each other and it’s very apparent there is mutual
respect. One employee noted there could always be more training and shadow shifts
for new staff, but it is sufficient currently. A couple employees noted frustration
regarding lack of planning for discharge for youth aging out. They reported having
difficulties with local office staff as well as community agencies such as CMH. They
1

reported they have made attempts to request frequent meetings to participate in
discharge planning efforts; however, CPA’s still do not have adequate plans.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on a review of the facility’s budget
and the agency’s financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on January 4, 2023.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility continue on their regular license.
